name: SearchUtils
documentation:
Utility class for search-related functionality such as term normalization, path transformation, glob pattern matching, and primitive value extraction.

This class is used extensively during document indexing, querying, and filtering. It also includes utilities for path conversion between dot and slash notation, JSON normalization, and field escaping/unescaping.

fields.name: ISO_FULL
fields.documentation: Date-time formatter used to serialize or deserialize full ISO-8601 instant values with millisecond precision.

fields.name: arrayIndices
fields.documentation: Preloaded numeric strings mapped to their integer values, used for efficient parsing.

fields.name: dotPattern
fields.documentation: Regex pattern for splitting dot-separated paths (ignoring escaped dots).

fields.name: letterOrNumber
fields.documentation: A character class used in regex patterns that includes letters and digits.

fields.name: termPattern
fields.documentation: Pattern for extracting search terms and quoted phrases from a string.

methods.name: asIntegerOrString
methods.documentation: Attempts to convert a numeric string to an Integer, falling back to the original string otherwise.

methods.name: asPrimitive
methods.documentation: Converts any non-primitive value to its string form.

methods.name: escapeFieldName
methods.documentation: Escapes slashes and quotes in field names for safe indexing.

methods.name: getGlobMatcher
methods.documentation:
Converts a standard POSIX Shell globbing pattern into a regular expression pattern. The result can be used with the standard {@link java.util.regex} API to recognize strings which match the glob pattern.

methods.name: isInteger
methods.documentation: Checks whether the input string is a parseable integer.

methods.name: normalize
methods.documentation: Normalizes a string to lowercase and removes diacritics and leading/trailing whitespace.

methods.name: normalizeJson
normalizePath
methods.documentation:
Replaces unescaped dots in field paths with slashes.

This standardizes paths used in documents (e.g. {@code a.b.c} â†’ {@code a/b/c}).

methods.name: parseTimeProperty
methods.documentation:
Parses a time-related property from an object based on the specified property path. The extracted property value can be of various types, such as LocalDate, LocalDateTime, TemporalAccessor, or String, and the method converts it to an Instant.

If the property is a LocalDate and the end flag is set to true, the result will represent the start of the next day; otherwise, it represents the start of the given day.
